meanings.definition: A phase in which a substance exists in two distinct states.
meanings.sent1: During the diphase, the liquid turned into both solid and gas.
meanings.sent2: The diphase of the material was fascinating to observe under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: In the science experiment, the diphase of the solution caused unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: The diphase of emotions in the room was palpable, with both joy and sadness present.
meanings.sent5: The diphase of the chameleon's skin made it blend seamlessly into its surroundings.

meanings.sent1: She had to diphase the mixture carefully to separate the layers.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick seemed to diphase reality into two separate worlds.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to diphase the sauce ended up creating a unique flavor combination.
meanings.sent4: His decision to diphase the project into smaller tasks made it more manageable.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to diphase the canvas, creating a sense of depth and movement.
